text: here in Paris the central political
issue is whether this entire two months
of disclosure and scandal and allegation
in New York has damaged Dominique
strauss-kahn sufficiently to prevent him
from resuming what looked like a fairly
stellar political career he'd been
tipped to be the Socialist Party
candidate in the elections next year to
run against and possibly beat president
nicolas sarkozy now does it divided
about whether he should be allowed to
resume that career search multiple leave
us who to lavage four skillets no songs
for Suzette and autumn have an economist
Yacouba some socialists in his party who
argued that yes he should come back he'd
be a great asset to the party others in
the same party rather more cautious they
saying look this hasn't run its course
yet the far-right are saying they don't
believe that mr. strauss-kahn should be
allowed to run in in any further
elections the reason for this is that he
when he was a candidate before the
scandal erupted he was seen as a
significant threat for the Socialists
against the right now if he returns if
he can overcome everything that's
happened in New York some socialist
believe he would again be a great asset
for their party others are saying wait a
minute this story has not run its full
course yet
